Pre-Game Insights: There seemed to be a 90-10 split between fans, with India supporters far outnumbering those of Pakistan.
Kartikeya Bhatotia, 27, and Aashish Khullar, 37, both Indian nationals living in Boston, said they were thrilled to see the longstanding rivalry come to the US.
The match was described as 'bigger than the Super Bowl' by some fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Basit Qadri, a 29-year-old Pakistan fan, said, 'Think of it as a Super Bowl — bigger than that,' referring to the excitement level of the match.
Hem Nerkar, 51, said, 'I’ve never seen such amazing energy. Always expected with India-Pakistan games. Fantastic energy.'

Joe La Porta, 32, said, 'This is my first match... and [my girlfriend] she’s really into cricket. I got myself into it since last year with the World Cup so I’m going to my first match here for T20. I’m really excited.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans descended on Long Island to watch the match, with thousands of cricket fans present.
There was reportedly a 90-10 split between India and Pakistan fans.
Kartikeya Bhatotia and Aashish Khullar bought opposing jerseys to show their support for the rivalry.
Parking lot attendant said the lot had met half-capacity by 8 a.m.
Groups of cricket enthusiasts rooted on both India and Pakistan from outside the stadium.
